newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Five farm green rates to devalue on Tuesday.
newsitem.headline: Five farm green rates to devalue on Tuesday.

text.p: The green rates of the German mark, Dutch guilder, Belgian franc, Austrian schilling and Swedish crown will be devalued on Tuesday, the European Commission said.

The new rates are 1.95929 per ecu for the green mark (old rate 1.95903), 2.20397 for the guilder (2.20270), 40.4285 for the Belgian franc (40.4180), 13.7910 for the Austrian schilling (13.7880) and 8.88562 for the Swedish crown (8.83274), it said in a faxed message.
The next monitoring period will be from May 6 to May 15, the U.K. Home Grown Cereals Authority said.
Green rates are used by the European Union to convert ecu-based farm subsidies paid out under the Common Agricultural Policy (CAP) into the currencies of its member states.
